results.title: GH: Year 10
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: Appeal
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
Edith is unhappy with her looks and her life when a combination of events lead her to take drastic action

results.title: UNmarked
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
In a cruel world where perfection is paramount, where do the less than perfect stand? Winner of the ACMI prize for best student animation 2004.

results.title: Mr Money
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
A gentleman traveller with a capitalistic spirit lays waste to the world around him. This orgy of progress concludes when the Gentleman becomes that which he once conquered.

results.title: Dog gone
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
Sal completed Dog Gone as a student at AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT. Utilising two different animation techniques (clay and hand drawn), this work is a short fantasy tale about an old dog who runs away from home to learn a few new tricks.

results.title: Eliminate Dr Sandwich
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from 2004 AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate.
What REALLY happened in July 1947 in the New Mexico desert? Great spoof pulls out all the old gags - and a few surprises.

results.title: Drifting in Antarctica
results.brief_description: Alice, a profoundly deaf Zoologist, tells of her experience as a volunteer seabird observer on a working icebreaker in Antarctica. Featuring excerpts from “The rime of the ancient mariner” by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
